title: Gołąbki (Polish Stuffed Cabbage Rolls)
description: Tender cabbage leaves stuffed with a savory mixture of meat and rice, baked in a rich tomato sauce - a beloved Polish family dish.
instructions: Bring large pot of water to boil. Core cabbage and place whole in boiling water. Cook for 10-15 minutes until leaves soften.
Carefully remove leaves as they loosen. Trim thick ribs from leaves. Set aside 12-16 large leaves.
Cook rice according to package but reduce cooking time by 5 minutes (it will finish cooking in oven).
In skillet, melt butter and sauté onions until translucent, about 8 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
In large bowl, mix ground meats, partially cooked rice, sautéed onions/garlic, egg, marjoram, paprika, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper, dill and parsley.
Place about 1/3 cup filling on each cabbage leaf. Fold sides over filling, then roll up tightly.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Arrange cabbage rolls seam-side down in large baking dish.
For sauce: Whisk tomato sauce, tomato paste, beef broth, flour, brown sugar, remaining salt and pepper.
Pour sauce over cabbage rolls, adding bay leaves. Cover tightly with foil.
Bake for 1.5 hours. Remove foil and bake 30 minutes more until sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
Let rest 15 minutes before serving. Serve with sour cream and crusty bread to soak up sauce.
